abstracts.cdata!:
The BEAC Regional Payment System Project
            for Central Africa aims at improving the efficiency and
            security of the payment system in the Central African
            Economic and Monetary Union. The project has eight main
            components. The Global Project Management component
            coordinates and implements the reform process, providing
            stakeholders with all needed information, communication, and
            training programs. The Electronic Bulk Payment Clearing
            Systems component manages the exchange and clearing process
            of bulk payments transactions, including the transformation
            of paper instruments into elctronic data. Identical
            electronic clearing systems will be installed in each
            country. A Real Time Gross Settlement mechansim (RTGS)
            enables instant and final irrevocable settlement of
            individual large value and other time criticial
            transactions, among other activities. The Inter Bank Card
            System served by a dedicated network infrastructure includes
            a pre-paid system for the poor in payment for their
            consumption of water and electricity. A Payment Risk
            Management System collects all informaton regarding payment
            incidents for individuals and companies, enabling a better
            control over unreliable customers' operations, and
            providing access to critical information to credit
            institutions and banks. Telecommunications infrastructure
            ensures high-quality, low-cost transfers of data and payment
            transactions among all locations. The project also has legal
            framework and training program components.
